data.title: Edmond/Edmund John Stephens
data.meta_description:
I reckon I may be searching for the Scarlet Pimpernel x 2 here!

This is my great-great grandfather.  He was born in 1854 or 1855 and was married to a...
data.meta_site_name: Family History UK Forum - Free UK Genealogy
data.text:
I reckon I may be searching for the Scarlet Pimpernel x 2 here!

This is my great-great grandfather. He was born in 1854 or 1855 and was married to a Louisa who was born in 1857. They were both born in Cardiff and had 12 kids.

I can find nothing about Edmond/Edmund John's parents or siblings nor the maiden name of Louisa.

If anyone could help, I'd be totally grateful. I have no clue where else I can look.

Thanks so much!

Hi Libby,

Welcome to the forum, you don't give Louisa's maiden name.

This looks like them in the 1881 census :

Name: Edmond Stephens

Age: 26

Estimated Birth Year: abt 1855

Relation: Head

Spouse's Name: Louisa Stephens

Gender: Male

Amanda

Yes it's definitely them, looks like Louisa was English and they married in her Parish which was usual:

ame: Edmund John Stephens

Birth Year: abt 1853

Marriage Date: 16 Jun 1874

Age: 21

Spouse: Louisa Payre

Spouse Age: 18

Event Type: Marriage

Parish: Gloucester, St Luke, Gloucestershire, England

Parish as it Appears: St Luke

I think her name was Payne rather than Payre

Amanda

Thanks so much for all your info. I'll have a look into it when I get home.

I couldn't give Louisa's maiden name, because I can't find it! All I know about her is that she was born in Cardiff and that the two of them had 12 kids, two of which died. I found them in the census and I know Louisa had her last kid at age 48, but when the last kid was about 6, Edmund J had already died.

Hi Libby,

Welcome to the forum, you don't give Louisa's maiden name.

This looks like them in the 1881 census :

Name: Edmond Stephens

Age: 26

Estimated Birth Year: abt 1855

Relation: Head

Spouse's Name: Louisa Stephens

Gender: Male

Where born: Cardiff, Glamorgan, Wales

Thanks very much. I did find them in the census, but I still can't get any other information, like Louisa's maiden name or Edmund/Edmond's parents to help me go back further.

Yes it's definitely them, looks like Louisa was English and they married in her Parish which was usual:

ame: Edmund John Stephens

Birth Year: abt 1853

Parish as it Appears: St Luke

Amanda

Thanks. The two of them were Welsh, but sometimes Wales and Gloucestershire and interchangeable on the Census for some reason. If you put "Cardiff" in as a search term, Gloucestershire turns up. Thanks. I reckon you found the answer there.

Yes it's definitely them, looks like Louisa was English and they married in her Parish which was usual:

ame: Edmund John Stephens

Parish as it Appears: St Luke

I think her name was Payne rather than Payre

Amanda

OK, so I checked this out and there was a Louisa Payne born in Cardiff in this year, so I reckon you cracked it. I was so stuck there for so long. The little trip to Gloucester may have been due to the fact that she was 5 months pregnant.
